title: Open-Faced Reuben
instructions: Make the dressing: In a small bowl, stir together all the dressing ingredients. Cover and chill for at least 30 minutes or up to overnight before serving. Make the sweet potatoes: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Cut the sweet potato fries into shapes. In a large bowl, toss the sweet potatoes with the olive oil, salt, and pepper. Spread out the sweet potatoes in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet and bake for 30 minutes, or until they start to brown and look crispy. Meanwhile, make the sandwiches: Put the corned beef and sauerkraut in two small baking pans, casserole dishes, or ramekins. Put them in the oven with the fries during the last 10 minutes, to warm them. Toast the bread. Spread each piece of toasted bread with about 1/4 cup of the dressing. Take the corned beef and sauerkraut out of the oven. Divide the corned beef between the two slices of bread. Add the pickles or serve them on the side. Top with the sauerkraut. Serve with the sweet potato fries on the side.

title: Simple Pancakes
instructions: 1. Mix dry ingredients. 2. Add wet ingredients and stir until just combined. 3. Cook on a hot griddle until bubbles form, then flip.

title: Lemon-Herb Baked Chicken
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F. Lightly brush a 13-by-9-inch baking dish with olive oil. Arrange the chicken and onions in the baking dish. Combine the broth, garlic, lemon juice, and tarragon or thyme, and pour it over the chicken and onions. Sprinkle with salt, pepper, and paprika. Bake for 30 minutes. Baste the chicken with the pan juices, and bake for 45 minutes longer (less for bone-in and boneless breasts), or until the chicken is cooked through and browned.

title: Apple Stuffed Chicken Breasts with Kale Pesto
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F. In a blender, chop the garlic. Add kale, walnuts, olive oil, lemon juice, thyme, sea salt, and black pepper, blending until smooth. Slice each chicken breast horizontally, leaving it attached at one side to open like a book. Cover with plastic wrap and pound to about ¼ inch thick. Season both sides with salt and pepper. Spread ¼ of the pesto over each chicken breast, then top with ¼ of the apple slices. Roll up the chicken breasts and wrap each with two slices of bacon, securing with toothpicks. Line a baking sheet with foil and top with a wire rack. Arrange the chicken breasts on the rack. Bake for 30 minutes. Turn on the broiler and broil for 5 minutes to crisp the bacon. Divide the romaine lettuce among four plates and top each with a chicken breast.

title: Classic Caesar Salad
instructions: 1. Wash and chop lettuce. 2. Mix dressing ingredients. 3. Toss with lettuce, add cheese and croutons.
notes: Add grilled chicken for a more substantial meal.

title: Jicama Steak Sandwich
instructions: Preheat a grill or broiler. Combine red onion and vinegar, setting aside. Season steak with salt and pepper. Grill or broil, turning once, until medium-rare (about 12 minutes total). Let steak rest for 5 minutes before slicing. Lay a jicama slice on each plate, spreading with mustard. Top with tomatoes, red onions, steak slices, and arugula. Serve immediately.

title: Beef Lo Mein
instructions: Make the sauce by whisking together chicken broth, tamari, garlic, ginger, arrowroot, and red chile paste in a small bowl. Set aside. Cook vermicelli according to package directions. In a large skillet, cook the beef over medium-high heat for 2 minutes. Transfer beef to a plate. In the same skillet, stir-fry the bell peppers, bean sprouts, curry powder, and broth for 3 minutes. Add mushrooms and peas, stir-frying for 2 minutes more. Stir in the sauce and return beef to the skillet. Stir and simmer until sauce thickens, about 8 minutes. Sprinkle with scallions and serve.

title: Vegetable Stir-Fry
instructions: 1. In a large pan, heat sesame oil over medium-high heat. 2. Add the garlic, ginger, and vegetables. Stir-fry for 5-7 minutes. 3. Stir in the soy sauce and cook for 2 more minutes. 4. Serve hot, garnished with sesame seeds or green onions.

title: Vegetable Stir-Fry
instructions: 1. In a large pan, heat sesame oil over medium-high heat. 2. Add the garlic, ginger, and vegetables. Stir-fry for 5-7 minutes. 3. Stir in the soy sauce and cook for 2 more minutes. 4. Serve hot, garnished with sesame seeds or green onions.

title: Chicken & Broccoli Bowl
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F. Mix the broth, vegetables (except the broccoli), 1 tablespoon parsley, and garlic in a large pot, and bring to a boil. Add the rice and bring back to a boil. Cover and simmer for about 30 minutes. Remove the lid and simmer for 5 more minutes, until rice is cooked. Set aside. While the rice cooks, put the chicken and broccoli in a mixing bowl, add the lime juice, parsley, salt, and pepper. Mix well until the chicken and broccoli are coated with the flavorings. Transfer the chicken and broccoli mixture to a large baking pan, spreading it evenly on the bottom with a spatula. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes. Remove the chicken from the oven and allow to cool. Divide the rice into four servings. Divide the chicken and broccoli mixture into four equal portions and place on top of the rice. Serve and enjoy.

title: Loaded Cowboy Burgers
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. In a large bowl, combine ground beef, grated carrot, crumbled bacon, spinach, red onion, egg whites, cilantro, 1 tablespoon coconut aminos, mustard, jalapeno, garlic, salt, pepper, and sriracha. Mix thoroughly, add oats, and mix again. Form mixture into four patties. Place patties on baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes, flipping halfway through. Toast buns during the last 8 minutes of cooking. In a skillet, heat broth over medium-high heat, then add sweet onion, mushrooms, remaining aminos, and balsamic vinegar. Sauté until onions and mushrooms are soft and liquid evaporates. Assemble burgers with onion-mushroom mixture and serve.

title: Spaghetti with Tomato Sauce
instructions: 1. Cook pasta according to package. 2. Sauté onion and garlic in oil. 3. Add sauce and seasonings, simmer 10 minutes. 4. Combine with pasta.
notes: Great base recipe that can be customized with vegetables or protein.

title: Authentic Puerto Rican Arroz Con Pollo
instructions: Pat the chicken dry with paper towels before combining with seasonings in a large bowl. Mix to coat the chicken evenly with spices. Heat the oil in a caldero or dutch oven over medium heat. Start with the chicken skin side down, turning to brown on all sides. Transfer to a plate and preheat the oven to 350°F. Toss sofrito and diced onion into the pot and sauté until the onions are translucent. Next add garlic, bell peppers, cilantro, salt and pepper, and cook until the garlic becomes fragrant. Pour in the 3 1/2 cups of broth and turn the heat up to high to bring everything to a boil. Boil for a few minutes before arranging the chicken pieces on top of the rice and covering. Transfer the pot into the preheated oven and cook for about 30 minutes, until the chicken reaches an internal temperature of 165°F. If you want the rice at the bottom of your pot to be crispy, pegao style, drizzle some oil around the edges of the pot, and set the pot back on the stovetop over medium heat. Cook for 5-10 minutes (watching closely to make sure it doesn't burn). Serve your rice with a squeeze of lime juice and sprinkle of chopped cilantro. Enjoy!

title: Mongolian Beef
instructions: In a bowl, toss steak slices with arrowroot. In a slow cooker, combine grapeseed oil, garlic, ginger, water, tamari, xylitol, and chile paste. Add steak, carrots, bell peppers, and 3/4 cup of scallions, stirring to coat. Cook on high for 3-4 hours or on low for 6 hours. When ready to serve, sauté cauliflower rice until tender. Serve beef mixture over cauliflower rice, garnishing with remaining scallions and sesame seeds.

title: Simple Pancakes
instructions: 1. Mix dry ingredients. 2. Add wet ingredients and stir until just combined. 3. Cook on a hot griddle until bubbles form, then flip.

title: Chicken Piccata
instructions: Preheat oven to 250°F. Place a baking pan in the oven to keep chicken warm. Pound chicken breasts to 1/2 inch thick. Cook vermicelli according to package instructions. Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a skillet. Dredge chicken in flour mixture, then cook for 4 minutes on each side, transferring to warm oven. Add shallot to pan and cook for 2 minutes, then add broth, lemon juice, coconut milk, and capers. Simmer for 3 minutes. Serve chicken over vermicelli, topped with sauce and garnished with lemon slices and parsley.

title: Classic Caesar Salad
instructions: 1. Wash and chop lettuce. 2. Mix dressing ingredients. 3. Toss with lettuce, add cheese and croutons.
notes: Add grilled chicken for a more substantial meal.

title: Slow-Cooker Greek-Style Chicken
instructions: In a large skillet over medium-high heat, brown the chicken thighs in olive oil. Transfer the chicken to the slow cooker. Add the chicken broth to the hot skillet and scrape up the browned bits from the bottom of the pan. Add the broth mixture to the slow cooker, along with the garlic, oregano, salt, and pepper. Cut enough thin slices from the Meyer lemon to cover the chicken, and lay them on top. Squeeze the remaining lemon juice into the slow cooker. Scatter the kalamata olives on top. Cover and cook on low for 4 hours. Serve with wild rice to soak up the lemony broth.

title: Copycat Papa John's Pizza Recipe
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 450 degrees. In a large bowl, combine flour, sugar, undissolved yeast, and salt. Gradually add water and oil to mixture. Blend at low speed until moistened, then beat for 2 minutes at medium speed until dough pulls away from sides of the bowl. On a lightly floured surface, knead until dough is smooth and elastic. Cover loosely with plastic wrap and let rest in a warm place for 15 minutes. Press out dough onto 3 pizza pans. Poke the dough randomly with a fork. Let rise again in a warm place for 10-15 minutes. Brush crusts lightly with oil and bake them for 5 minutes. Remove from oven and top as desired. Bake for 4-5 more minutes or until the crust is golden brown. Pizza Sauce: 1. Combine all ingredients in a large saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and let simmer for 15-20 minutes.

title: Vegetable Stir-Fry
instructions: 1. In a small bowl, combine soy sauce, hoisin sauce, and sesame oil. Set aside. 2. Heat vegetable oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. 3. Add bell peppers, carrot, and broccoli. Stir-fry for 5-6 minutes until vegetables are tender-crisp. 4. Add green onions, garlic, and sauce. Stir-fry for 2-3 minutes, coating vegetables in sauce. Serve immediately.

title: Chicken Paella
instructions: Heat broth in a deep pot over medium heat. Sauté onion, carrots, celery, and lima beans until onions are translucent. Add seasoned chicken and cook until no longer pink. Stir in peppers, garlic, tomatoes, saffron, and paprika, then add rice, broth, rosemary, salt, and pepper. Simmer on low for an hour, until rice is tender. Brown sausage in a pan, then add sausage and capers to the paella.

title: Classic Caesar Salad
instructions: 1. Wash and chop lettuce. 2. Mix dressing ingredients. 3. Toss with lettuce, add cheese and croutons.
notes: Add grilled chicken for a more substantial meal.

title: Spaghetti with Tomato Sauce
instructions: 1. Cook pasta according to package. 2. Sauté onion and garlic in oil. 3. Add sauce and seasonings, simmer 10 minutes. 4. Combine with pasta.
notes: Great base recipe that can be customized with vegetables or protein.

title: Chicken Pot Pie
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Place the chicken on a foil-lined baking sheet, drizzle with 1 tablespoon of the olive oil, season generously with salt and pepper, and bake for 35 minutes. Remove from the oven, let cool enough to handle, and cut into 1/2-inch cubes. To make the crust, mix all the crust ingredients thoroughly. Form into a disk, wrap in plastic wrap, and refrigerate for 30 minutes. Preheat the oven to 375°F. In a wide pot over medium-high heat, add the remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil. Add the onions and cook, stirring frequently, until golden brown. Add the next 6 ingredients (carrots through sage). Stir the arrowroot into the coconut or almond milk to dissolve, then add to the pot, stirring until the sauce is slightly thickened. Divide the filling among 8 1-cup ramekins. Roll out the crust between two sheets of parchment paper, cut out 8 circles, and place one on top of each ramekin. Sprinkle lightly with sea salt and bake for 30 minutes. Serve warm.

title: Skillet Chicken With Fennel and Walnuts
Herby Salmon with Garlic Butter Mushrooms
instructions: Quarter 1 pound cremini mushrooms. Mince 4 garlic cloves. Strip the leaves off 6 fresh thyme sprigs. Pat 4 salmon fillets dry with paper towels, then season on both sides with 1 teaspoon of the kosher salt and 1/4 teaspoon of the black pepper. Heat 2 tablespoons of the olive oil in a large nonstick skillet with a lid over medium-high heat until shimmering. Add the salmon skin-side up and sear until golden-brown on the bottom, about 4 minutes. Transfer the salmon skin-side down to a plate (it will not be cooked through). Melt 2 tablespoons unsalted butter in the pan. Add the mushrooms and sear undisturbed until the bottoms are well-browned, about 3 minutes. Add the garlic, half the thyme leaves, and the remaining 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt and 1/4 teaspoon black pepper. Cook, stirring once or twice, until the mushrooms are browned all over and just tender, about 3 minutes. Reduce the heat to medium. Return the salmon skin-side down to the pan, nestling it into the mushrooms. Cover and cook the salmon to desired doneness, 2 to 5 minutes depending on the thickness of the fillets. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the middle of the thickest fillet should register 120°F to 130°F for medium-rare or 135°F to 145°F if you prefer it more well-done. Sprinkle with the remaining thyme.

title: Chicken Sausage Bowl
instructions: Heat a large nonstick pan over medium heat. Add the sausage and cook until browned, stirring often. Add the mushrooms, onion, bell peppers, garlic, and broth and simmer for 3 minutes. Add the sweet potato and cilantro and cook, stirring often, for about 3 minutes, until the sweet potato is warm. Pour the mixture over the brown rice and top with salsa.

title: Garden Meatballs
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F. Combine all ingredients in a large mixing bowl. Roll mixture into meatballs and place in a baking dish. Bake for 25-35 minutes, turning halfway through. Serve warm or store for later. Can be frozen in individual portions for easy access.
